name: copy matrices if requested
description:
For each input data checks, if the corresponding condition is fulfilled. If yes, this function copies it (if it exist) into the corresponding output. If not, the corresponding output stays to be non-initialized.
This function helps to request calculation of some subset of data, depending on several boolean flags, passed to the condition inputs.

in_ports.caption: if (xxx)...
in_ports.name: if_m1
in_ports.hint: Should contain numbers value, indication true/false condition (see "What string is true").

in_ports.caption: ...then m1
in_ports.name: m1
in_ports.hint:
If the condition above is fulfilled, this data is copied into the corresponding output.
In other case, this data is ignored and not requested to be calculated!

controls.caption: What string is true
controls.name: conditionStyle
controls.description:
What input condition "xxx" is considered to be true and what is false.

C-like: true is non-zero number or non-empty string, containing not a number, false is 0, 0.0, empty, non-initialized string.

Java-like: true is "true" string (ignoring case), false is any other string, including non-initialized.

Note that "true" string, according these rules, is considered to be true in all modes.

controls.caption: Invert condition
controls.name: invert
controls.description: If set, the input condition above is inverted: execution is cancelled when "xxx" is false and continued (with a copy of input data) when "xxx" is true.
